annotation.TEXT: Yes, the game actually crashed when I got a double KO on this fight. Fortunately, this game auto-saves in between every fortress stage, so the only downside was that I had to replay Wily 3. With that being said though...I'd say that fight was close enough, so I'm just gonna go ahead to Wily 4 now. >_>

The lasers here aren't just normal hazards. From what I can tell, they can either heal you or instantly kill you depending on what type of pill effect you're under (blue lasers heal for the standard milk pill and kill you under the chocolate milk pill, with red lasers being vice-versa).

Wily 2 introduces a new variation on the floating platforms from Hello's stage. These ones change direction in a clockwise motion each time you jump on them. It works well for the most part...until you try to get them to go left (which sometimes causes Mega Man to fidget for a bit until the platform changes directions).

Granted, there are a few flaws here and there (most notably some technical/engine related things seen before, such as platform clipping - and of course the one game crashing bug seen in this video), but the creator, SnoruntPyro, has been working quite a bit to fix these issues with new updates, among other gameplay related aspects.

The first fortress boss seems to be more of an endurance round than a traditional battle. The boss itself seems to be weak to the homing Robo Punch...but the punch itself likes to home in on the other projectiles that the boss throws out. I've heard that this particular problem is being worked on in the next update, so hopefully it will be a more viable option for this fight as a result.

Well then...that was certainly a thing, wasn't it? In all seriousness, though: Despite the fact that this was all one big joke, this game is actually pretty neat. While some things may seem a bit off-putting at first, trust me when I say that this is an enjoyable trip of a game.

Perhaps it's just me, but this game also feels pretty short in comparison to some of the other fan-games out there, though I personally don't mind that too much (in fact, I think it actually helps out this game a bit by keeping it at a reasonable length). Whatever the case may be, if you have some time to kill and want to play something that doesn't take itself seriously by any means, I definitely recommend this. Heck, even if you're not actively seeking to play a joke game, I'd still say this is well worth playing.

Wily 4 has one new variation gimmick for us: Brown/White pills act the same as the standard pills from Milk's stage, only these ones cause you to lose health when you're not submerged in what I assume to be chocolate milk.

Well...This choice of music certainly takes me back a bit (it's been a while since I've played MM Revolution, but considering that project got handed over to Sprites INC, this serves as a nice reminder of some new things to eventually come).

All right, so there were two spots I ended up using Rush Jet in. This was the one I was referring to back in the second segment (while the one in Doc-Milk's stage was a strategy I only decided on afterwards).
